data.title: Workforce Breeders' Cup doubt
data.meta_description: Firm ground threatens to rule British favourites Workforce and Midday out of the Breeders' Cup this weekend.
data.text:
Firm ground threatens to rule British favourites Workforce and Midday out of the Breeders' Cup this weekend.

After Turf hotpot Workforce had taken his first steps on the Churchill Downs course yesterday, Sir Michael Stoute's assistant, Stuart Messenger, expressed himself "extremely disappointed" with the state of the track, while big-race jockey Ryan Moore conceded: "It's quicker than ideal.

"If it is deemed to be too fast by Sir Michael, he might not run."

And Henry Cecil, whose Midday heads the market in her quest for for backto-back successes in the Filly & Mare Turf on Friday, also has misgivings.

"They've got to take the jar out of the ground," said the Warren Place legend. "You can't expect millionpound horses to run on a road."
